title: Was the 18th century men's neck cloth (ancestor of the necktie) originally a functional item? It seems as if it would work well to sacrificially absorb skin grease, sweat and dirt and so preserve the collar of a wool coat. - Quora

response.answer_text: The necktie is descended from the cravat a neckcloth worn by 17th Century Croat mercenaries, in French service. Like other neckcloths, it served to reduce and conceal soiling of shirts. Given its military origin, the cravat may also have been worn to prevent chaffing of the neck by a gorget, curiass, or the stiff collar of a buff coat. Cravat - Wikipedia
